The #VICTIMAct provides funding to law enforcement agencies & prosecution offices for training & technology that supports justice for violent crime, as well as resources for victims.

The #MentalHealthJusticeAct will create federal grants to hire, train, and dispatch mental health professionals to respond to crisis situations involving individuals with mental health challenges & intellectual or developmental disabilities.

The #BreakTheCycleofViolenceAct will provide funding to support & establish Community Violence Intervention (CVI) programs.

CVI funding is awarded to community groups, like @buffalopeace, who serve as trusted messengers in neighborhoods to solve conflicts & prevent violence.

The #InvestToProtectAct will make targeted investments in local police departments with less than 125 officers.

Annual funding will support training, mental health resources, safety equipment, as well as recruitment & retention for local officers.

While no legislation is perfect, I believe this package of public safety bills takes a holistic approach‚Äîthrough mental health services, victim support services, and additional funding for violence prevention programs‚Äîthat will lead to safer communities throughout #MO05.

The #VICTIMAct provides additional resources to support victims of crime and their families, as well as funding to law enforcement agencies and prosecution offices so they can increase the number of cases cleared and help victims obtain justice.

The #MentalHealthJusticeAct will create a federal grant program to help local law enforcement hire, train, and utilize mental health professionals as first responders in situations where an individual may be having a mental health crisis.

The #InvestToProtectAct will provide targeted investments to local police departments with less than 125 officers.
 
This funding will go toward de-escalation training, mental health resources, safety equipment, and the recruitment and retention of local officers.

The #BreakTheCycleOfViolenceAct, which I was proud to cosponsor, will provide long overdue funding for evidence-based community violence prevention and intervention programs that have proved to cut down on crime and create safer communities.
